description.message: Say goodbye to millions of open chrome windows that clutter your screen and slow your machine! A tab manager for the power user.

introtext2.message: Here are a few tips to get you started.

introtext7.message: sites you use all the time

introtext9.message: sites you want to save for laterâ€”these bookmarks will be deleted once you look at them

introtext11.message: put all your other bookmarks in this category

introtext13.message: 'project' bookmarks. we'll explain this in a minute!

introtext16.message: Navigate search results with arrow keys, and open them with the Return key.

introtext17.message: Hold down the Shift key with the Return key to open the bookmark in a new tab.

introtext22.message: Projects are a neat way to manage a workspace with your tabs.

introtext23.message: They remember all the tabs you have open in a window, so that with one click you can bring them all up.

introtext24.message: And of course, if you open or close tabs in the window, those changes will be there next time you open the project.

introtext25.message: Projects are a great way to work productively, without having a million tabs open at a time.

introtext27.message: 1. In a single window, open all the tabs you want in your project.

introtext28.message: 2. Use the keyboard shortcut "command / ctrl + p", or click the 'create project' button on the menu.

introtext29.message: 3. Type in a name for the project and press enter

introtext31.message: We hope you'll enjoy using Bookmarker!
